triples.name: Political polarization
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new mechanism for how political polarization emerges through partisan sorting driven by digital media.

triples.name: Partisan sorting
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that partisan sorting is the key mechanism through which digital media drive affective polarization.

triples.name: Affective polarization
triples.relevance: The paper draws on affective polarization literature to shift focus from ideological divergence to emotional divisions between groups.

triples.name: Echo chamber (media)
triples.relevance: The paper challenges the dominant echo chamber hypothesis as an explanation for digital media-driven polarization.

triples.name: Digital media
triples.relevance: The paper examines how digital media facilitate interaction patterns that drive polarization through partisan alignment.

triples.name: Mathematical models of social learning
triples.relevance: The paper draws on opinion dynamics literature and social learning models to build its causal mechanism.
